content.new:
Hello,

I created simple C\+\+ and Python wrappers for Gazebo \(9\) server, to have more control over simulation execution. The project is here: [https://github.com/mvukov/gazebo\_server](https://github.com/mvukov/gazebo_server). While running gazebo::runWorld\(world\_, 1\) \(step-by-step, no callbacks\) works fine in C\+\+ and the Python wrapper, I have problems with gazebo::runWorld\(world\_, num\_steps\) with num\_steps > 1 and using callbacks. The function is here [https://github.com/mvukov/gazebo\_server/blob/master/src/gazebo\_server.cpp#L164](https://github.com/mvukov/gazebo_server/blob/master/src/gazebo_server.cpp#L164).

In master branch I disabled the relevant Python binding, but in this PR [https://github.com/mvukov/gazebo\_server/pull/1](https://github.com/mvukov/gazebo_server/pull/1) I enabled it such that someone can take a look.

On both macOS \(Mojave\) and Linux the tests run fine. At test exit on macOS test app crashes and on Linux \(CircleCI machine\) the test app never exits. Here is a part of the crash report on macOS:

```
Thread 0 Crashed:: Dispatch queue: com.apple.main-thread

0   libgazebo_rendering.9.dylib     0x000000011110b5d0 gazebo::rendering::RenderEngine::Root() const + 8

1   libgazebo_rendering.9.dylib     0x0000000111171b72 gazebo::rendering::WindowManager::Fini() + 40

2   libgazebo_rendering.9.dylib     0x0000000111171b23 gazebo::rendering::WindowManager::~WindowManager() + 25

3   libgazebo_rendering.9.dylib     0x0000000111171c24 gazebo::rendering::WindowManager::~WindowManager() + 14

4   libgazebo_rendering.9.dylib     0x000000011109583d boost::detail::shared_count::~shared_count() + 29

5   libgazebo_rendering.9.dylib     0x00000001111076b8 std::__1::unique_ptr<gazebo::rendering::RenderEnginePrivate, std::__1::default_delete<gazebo::rendering::RenderEnginePrivate> >::~unique_ptr() + 46

6   libsystem_c.dylib               0x00007fff661b43cf __cxa_finalize_ranges + 319

7   libsystem_c.dylib               0x00007fff661b46b3 exit + 55

8   org.python.python               0x000000010aca326a Py_Exit + 30

9   org.python.python               0x000000010aca94f2 handle_system_exit + 314

10  org.python.python               0x000000010aca9146 PyErr_PrintEx + 54

11  org.python.python               0x000000010aca8934 PyRun_SimpleFileExFlags + 964

12  org.python.python               0x000000010acc1017 pymain_main + 4937

13  org.python.python               0x000000010acc18a7 _Py_UnixMain + 75

14  libdyld.dylib                   0x00007fff6610e3d5 start + 1
```

GazeboServer::RunFor\(\) is quite straightforward, I could not find any bugs there.

Any help is appreciated.

Cheers,

Milan

‌

Hello,

I created a simple C\+\+ and Python wrapper for Gazebo \(9\) server, to have more control over simulation execution. The project is here: [https://github.com/mvukov/gazebo\_server](https://github.com/mvukov/gazebo_server). While running gazebo::runWorld\(world\_, 1\) \(step-by-step, no callbacks\) works fine in C\+\+ and the Python wrapper, I have problems with gazebo::runWorld\(world\_, num\_steps\) with num\_steps > 1 and using callbacks. The function is here [https://github.com/mvukov/gazebo\_server/blob/master/src/gazebo\_server.cpp#L164](https://github.com/mvukov/gazebo_server/blob/master/src/gazebo_server.cpp#L164).

In master branch I disabled the relevant Python binding, but in this PR [https://github.com/mvukov/gazebo\_server/pull/1](https://github.com/mvukov/gazebo_server/pull/1) I enabled it such that someone can take a look.

On both macOS \(Mojave\) and Linux the tests run fine. At test exit on macOS test app crashes and on Linux \(CircleCI machine\) the test app never exits. Here is a part of the crash report on macOS:

GazeboServer::RunFor\(\) is quite straightforward, I could not find any bugs there.

Any help is appreciated.

Cheers,

Milan

issue.title: Problems with running Gazebo 9 server in a Python wrapper
Problems with running Gazebo 9 server in a Python wrapper
